page.title: 18VILLAGE SCHOOL CLOSES
page.content: Set back from the old A604(now bypassed) stands a lovely old redbrick building.Its arched doorways,and high gables are typical of the Board Schools built in the area around a hundred years ago.At one time the infants had one small room, and the junior boys and girls were srictly segregated.Next to it stands the "schoolmasters house"in a similar style. For over a century children from the village and outlying farms had gathered here to begin and often end their education.By 1980 the numbers were sadly diminishing, and it was decided that the school must close. There were just 17 children on roll, this was a sad blow for the village,1985, the end of an era. The last few children were transferred to Camps, or Linton. The local council bought the school for a village hall.
